column4: Hiyas - I am seeing somewhat poor performance copying files between 2 11.04 computers I was getting ~600kbs
after setting netbios name and ensuring that they are mounted via 'cifs' I am now seeing ~1.2 mb/s which is still alot slower than I think it should be
adhoc or infrastructure?
btw, kbs is not a measure of transfer rate
sure.
access point in between? or is it really going through a router?
I couldn't tell you tbh, they are close enough that they could talk directly - but they are both being served by a wifi router that gives them their IP
what is the wifi data rate reported by each?
they can't talk directly if it's infrastructure; but obviously they share a channel so only one can talk at once
waiting for a transfer to finish up, then I'll try to look at rates for other transports
with 54Mb/s, you can expect to get about 15Mb/s of real throughput. this is obviously shared between them, though, as they are on the same channel, so 7.5Mb/s would be a maximum for end-to-end
a general rule of thumb is that with TCP transfer, on a 10Mb/s link you get about 1MB/s of throughput. so on your 7.5Mb/s link, I would expect about 750kB/s of actual data transfer
8.35Mb/s is comparable to the 7.5Mb/s I suggested you would get
you really have to use m, M, b and B correctly when talking about this stuff
sure, are you?
errm, yes
anyway - iperf is telling me ~8 MBits which I interpret as ~1 MByte/s no?
yes -- but you didn't say that, you said 1 mb/s. sorry for being pedantic but it's actually really important in a discussion like this
only if context escapes you
errm, well, how should I know what the program you're using to transfer files reports?
anyway, 8Mb/s of iperf throughput means you will generally get something like 0.8MB/s of real data throughput once you've got TCP and other protocol overheads
so your 0.6MB/s that you initially reported is a little low, but not massively
